alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:51PM EST until February 19 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST FOR SULLIVAN AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 149 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near West Shokan to 6 miles northwest of Werry Lake, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 99 and 116. Interstate 84 between 20 and 53. Locations impacted include... Fallsburg, Bushkill, Monticello, Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Liberty, Bethel, Paupack, Neversink and South Fallsburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
